events.description: The first public appearance and speech by BoJ board member Kazuyuki Masu since joining the board in July.

facts.fact_text: Kazuyuki Masu joined the Bank of Japan's nine-member board in July.

evidences.evidence_text: The speech was Masu’s first public appearance since joining the Bank of Japan’s nine-member board last July

claims.claim_text: Further interest rate hikes are necessary to complete Japan’s monetary policy normalization.
claims.author: Kazuyuki Masu

evidences.evidence_text: Further interest rate hikes will be necessary to complete Japan’s monetary policy normalization, central bank board member Kazuyuki Masu said in a speech on Friday.

claims.claim_text: Raising rates would help reduce the policy divergence between Japan and other major economies.
claims.author: Kazuyuki Masu

evidences.evidence_text: Masu noted that raising rates would help reduce the policy divergence between Japan and other major economies

claims.claim_text: Policy divergence is a key driver of prolonged yen weakness.
claims.author: Kazuyuki Masu

evidences.evidence_text: a gap widely seen as a key driver of prolonged yen weakness that has pushed up import costs for businesses and households.

claims.claim_text: Aggressive rate hikes could disrupt the gradual upward trend in wages and inflation.
claims.author: Kazuyuki Masu

evidences.evidence_text: warning against raising rates too aggressively in a way that could disrupt the gradual upward trend in wages and inflation.

evidence.evidence_text: Further interest rate hikes will be necessary to complete Japan’s monetary policy normalization
a gap widely seen as a key driver of prolonged yen weakness
yen weakness that has pushed up import costs for businesses and households.
timely and appropriate rate hikes are needed to keep underlying inflation below 2%
